snippet: Border authorities in South Texas have been overwhelmed by a recent surge of young illegal migrants traveling by themselves, leading the Department of Homeland Security to call for resources from other agencies.
abstract: Department of Homeland Security declares a crisis and moves to set up emergency shelter for youths as young illegal immigrants traveling by themselves surge into South Texas; also issues alert as official recognition that federal agencies overseeing borders, immigration enforcement and child welfare have been outstripped by a sudden increase in unaccompanied minors.
lead_paragraph: Border authorities in South Texas have been overwhelmed by a recent surge of young illegal migrants traveling by themselves, leading the Department of Homeland Security to call for resources from other agencies.

headline.main: U.S. Setting Up Emergency Shelter in Texas as Youths Cross Border Alone
headline.print_headline: U.S. Setting Up Emergency Shelter in Texas as Youths Cross Border Alone
